text: Hello everyone, i have a situation where `hs_amp=true` is being added to the url for the blog post viewed in mobile linked or twitter apps. I already disable google amp in the blog settings and in the post publish options. Does anyone know how i could disable this `hs_amp=true` for the post viewed in mobile social apps?
How are you getting to the post? Even with amp turned it shouldn't redirect like that
just to clarify - this is my poll, not something by HubSpot.
you should replace your name with  that phrase :slightly_smiling_face:
lol  Hi my name is not something by HubSpot

hello <@U7SL518D6> i click the post shared in linked in and the post opens in linkedin app.
ahhh, it’s likely linkedin is injecting it

The sandbox account = Full CMS (you just can't launch a site without upgrading to paid) + CRM + All Free tools (marketing, sales, service).

You are able to upgrade the sandbox accounts to a paid account at anytime to unlock any of the regular features of HubSpot. :slightly_smiling_face:
Not sure if that answers your question  - please let me know if you mean something different by "privileges/access".

note - the membership functionality ( <#CD5RBLPBL|cms-membership> ) is not included in the sandbox at this time - since it's technically a Marketing Enterprise feature at the moment. We do understand it would be helpful to have in the sandbox to play around with and learn... so maybe something in the future. But for now, not.
thank you for that clarification Luke, makes perfect sense. could see people trying to abuse the sandbox if that feature were enabled.

I'd love to see a world where ALLLLLLLL features HubSpot offers (enterprise and beyond) is included in the developers account... Ya'll need to learn the tools after all, haha. It's will take some time before we can make that happen ... lots to sort out, some behind-the-scenes organization needs to happen here, and need to (like you said) think about potential abuses or risks.
I think it is a preference issue. I see it a lot in phone and js
